channel.title: EduThink with Gavin Kennedy
channel.copyright: Solid Gold Studios - all rights reserved
channel.description: The podcast that explores Education in South Africa.
channel.itunes:subtitle: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world." - Nelson Mandela
channel.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
channel.itunes:summary: From Solid Gold Studios, this is EduThink - the podcast that explores Education in South Africa. If you're a parent, a pupil, a teacher, a principal, or interested in any aspect of education, then this podcast is for you. Hosted by entrepreneur, pragmatic optimist, small business improvement consultant, and podcast producer - Gavin Kennedy.
channel.itunes:keywords: EduThink, Edu Thin, Think about education, EduInc, Education Incorporated Boutique School, Education, School, Solid Gold Studios, another Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy, #BeHeard

item.author: eduthink@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Podcast Studios)
item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Podcast Studios
item.title: Disrupting to Innovate Change in the Edu Space | Charlotte D Blignaut, Shirley Lloyd, Jill Lithgow and Gershom Aitchison
item.itunes:title: Disrupting to Innovate Change in the Edu Space | Charlotte D Blignaut, Shirley Lloyd, Jill Lithgow and Gershom Aitchison
item.itunes:subtitle: A round table discussion at EduTech
item.description:
Join Charlotte D Blignaut as she leads a round table panel discussion at the 2019 EduTech conference in Sandton with Shirley Lloyd, a recently retired Director from the NQF Directorate for the Department of Higher Education, Jill Lithgow, the Educations Solutions lead for Johnson and Johnson in South Africa, and Gershom Aitchison, co-founder and headmaster of Education Incorporated, a boutique school in Fourways.


If you want to know more about EduInc Boutique School, book a tour to visit them now. https://educationincorporated.co.za/tour-request-form.php


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za
item.content:encoded:
Join Charlotte D Blignaut as she leads a round table panel discussion at the 2019 EduTech conference in Sandton with Shirley Lloyd, a recently retired Director from the NQF Directorate for the Department of Higher Education, Jill Lithgow, the Educations Solutions lead for Johnson and Johnson in South Africa, and Gershom Aitchison, co-founder and headmaster of Education Incorporated, a boutique school in Fourways.


If you want to know more about EduInc Boutique School, book a tour to visit them now. https://educationincorporated.co.za/tour-request-form.php

item.author: eduthink@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios)
item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Family + School = a future-proofed child | Nikki Bush (Human Potential and Parenting), Gershom and Jacqueline Aitchison (Founders, Headmaster Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School)
item.itunes:title: Family + School = a future-proofed child | Nikki Bush (Human Potential and Parenting), Gershom and Jacqueline Aitchison (Founders, Headmaster Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School)
item.itunes:subtitle: The value of skills and flexibility when future-proofing a child
item.description:
In this episode Nikki Bush (human potential and parenting speaker and author) and Gershom and Jacqueline Aitchison (founders, headmaster and director of Education Incorporated Boutique School) talk to host Gavin Kennedy about Nikki's new book, Future Proof your child for the 2020's and Beyond, and how this dovetails with the educational philosophy of Education Incorporated Boutique School. They discuss the importance of family and school in skills development for future success and the ultimate objective when navigating the stress of choosing subjects for FET.


Contact Nikki Bush via her website. click here


If you want to know more about EduInc Boutique School, book a tour to visit them now. https://educationincorporated.co.za/tour-request-form.php


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: How to Suck Less in Public | Richard Mulholland (Co-Founder of Missing Link and TalkDrawer, International Speaker and Top CEO Coach)
item.itunes:title: How to Suck Less in Public | Richard Mulholland (Co-Founder of Missing Link and TalkDrawer, International Speaker and Top CEO Coach)
item.itunes:subtitle: 4 steps to better presentations and public speaking
item.description:
Join us as Richard Mulholland talks to the children, and staff, at Education Incorporated school in Fourways about the value of being a confident and effective presenter. He also shares life advice (on tattoos and motorbikes) and answers some interesting questions from the children.


Connect with the amazing Richard Mulholland click here

Want to see what a school looks like with 10 children in a class? click here


If you're ready to produce your own podcast, contact the podcast experts at SolidGoldStudios.co.za

item.author: eduthink@solidgoldstudios.co.za (Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios)
item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: It's a big world out there, start exploring! | Tamin-Lee Connolly (World Challenge) and Gershom Aitchison (Headmaster : EduInc Boutique School)
item.itunes:title: It's a big world out there, start exploring! | Tamin-Lee Connolly (World Challenge) and Gershom Aitchison (Headmaster : EduInc Boutique School)
item.itunes:subtitle: Sparking personal growth through transformative adventures
item.description:
Today Gershom Aitchison (Headmaster : EduInc Boutique school in Fourways) and Tamin-Lee Connolly (Regional Manager : World Challenge) talk about the benefits of travel for high school pupils. They explain how World Challenge works, from planning, to fund-raising, to departing and making a difference somewhere else in the world. They also elaborate on the objectives and methods used for children to learn independence, leadership and contribution.


Visit World Challenge and start your child's travel adventure today! click here

Visit Education Incorporated for more information about very small classes and a boutique school experience. click here


Are you ready to produce your own podcast? SolidGoldStudios.co.za

They also elaborate on the objectives and methods used for children to learn independence, leadership and contribution.

item.title: Teachers, Teamwork and the Future World of Work | Andee Deverell and Gershom Aitchison
item.itunes:subtitle: Teachers, Teamwork and the Future World of Work
item.description:
Our guests Andee Deverell (head of Organisation Design, Change and HR Communications at Nedbank) and Gershom Aitchison (headmaster at Education Incorporated, a Private Boutique school in Fourways) talk about Teachers, Teamwork and the Future World of Work.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/eduthink

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy and Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: What can South African schools learn from Finland? | Jax Aitchison and Carmen Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: What do South African and Finnish schools have in common? What's different? What can we learn from Finland?
item.description:
Gavin Kennedy re-broadcasts a Carmen Murray discussion with Jacqueline Aitchison, Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School, about the differences and similarities between South African and Finnish schools and what we can learn from them.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/eduthink
item.itunes:summary: Gavin Kennedy re-broadcasts a Carmen Murray discussion with Jacqueline Aitchison, Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School, about the differences and similarities between South African and Finnish schools and what we can learn from them.
item.itunes:keywords: Carmen Murray, Boo-Yah!, Jax Aitchison, Education Incorporated Boutique School, Finland, Education, School, Solid Gold Studios, another Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy and Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Educating Your 22nd Century Child | Jax Aitchison and Carmen Murray
item.itunes:subtitle: What parents ought to know when choosing the right school for their child.
item.description:
Gavin Kennedy re-broadcasts a Carmen Murray discussion with Jacqueline Aitchison, Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School, about Jax's book titled 'Educating Your 22nd Century Child'.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/eduthink
item.itunes:summary: Gavin Kennedy re-broadcasts a Carmen Murray discussion with Jacqueline Aitchison, Director of Education Incorporated Boutique School, about Jax's book titled 'Educating Your 22nd Century Child'.

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Robotics in schools | Gershom Aitchison, Phillip Haas and Gordon Whitcher
item.itunes:subtitle: Is robotics in schools just for fun? Or is it the future?
item.description:
Gavin Kennedy talks to Phillip Haas, from 'Hands On Technology', Gershom Aitchison, Headmaster of Education Incorporated Boutique School, and Gordon Whitcher about the exciting world of robotics in schools. Discussion is around Lego Mindstorm and the value of robotics as part of the official curriculum, or as an extra-mural activity.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/EduThink
item.itunes:summary: Gavin Kennedy talks to Phillip Haas, from 'Hands On Technology', Gershom Aitchison, Headmaster of Education Incorporated Boutique School, and Gordon Whitcher about the exciting world of robotics in schools. Discussion is around Lego Mindstorm and the value of robotics as part of the official curriculum, or as an extra-mural activity.
item.itunes:keywords: Gershom Aitchison, Education Incorporated Boutique School, Phillip Haas, Hands On Technology, Lego Mindstorm, Gordon Whitcher, Education, School, Solid Gold Studios, another Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Grade 4 (il)literacy | Joan Griebenow and Aurora Schoch
item.itunes:subtitle: Why can't our children read? What can we do about it today?
item.description:
Gavin Kennedy talks to Joan Griebenow, past principal of Bryandale Primary School, and Aurora Schoch, from the Lonehill International Academy, about the alarming state of South African literacy, as well as practical strategies to turn this around.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/EduThink
item.itunes:summary: Gavin Kennedy talks to Joan Griebenow, past principal of Bryandale Primary School, and Aurora Schoch, from the Lonehill International Academy, about the alarming state of South African literacy, as well as practical strategies to turn this around.
item.itunes:keywords: Joan Griebenow, Bryandale Primary School, Aurora Schoch, Lonehill Academy, PIRLS, reading, books, Education, School, Solid Gold Studios, another Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy

item.itunes:author: Gavin Kennedy | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Choosing subjects for Grade 9 pupils | Gershom Aitchison, John Skelton and Andrew Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: The importance of appropriate subject choices, and how to choose them.
item.description:
Gavin Kennedy talks to Education Incroporated Headmaster, Gershom Aitchison, Bryanston High Principal, John Skelton, and Andrew Jones about the challenges facing parents of Grade 9 children who must choose their subjects for the last 3 years of their schooling.

Show notes are available at SolidGoldStudios.co.za/eduthink
item.itunes:summary: Gavin Kennedy talks to Education Incroporated Headmaster, Gershom Aitchison, Bryanston High Principal, John Skelton, and Andrew Jones about the challenges facing parents of Grade 9 children who must choose their subjects for the last 3 years of their schooling.
item.itunes:keywords: John Skelton, Bryanston High School, Gershom Aitchison, Education Incorporated Boutique School, Andrew Jones, Kip McGrath, Grade 9 subject choices, Education, School, Solid Gold Studios, another Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy
